answers.answer: you are both definitely 100% HIV-negativeno more testing is necessaryabsolutely no worries for you!(except for buying strollers, toys, diapers etc.)God BlessP.S. Use this experience to your advantage.Your husband will obey your every command for years to come.
Thanks, you're right, I shouldn't be here. Since that time I've been eating and sleeping with this fear. So are you in the medical field? You seem to know a lot about HIV. God bless you too.
Yes, I am a doctor and yes, you should leave this forum immediately and eat, rest and enjoy this special time in your life.  There is no reason for you to have the slightest worry about HIV.
You are in the clear, I agree with Stupid !RegardsMike
No, I'm not however I know my stuffs since I had my own scare and I have taken my time to read a lot about it.

Thanks again guys, my husband's getting tested just because he hasn't been tested since the affair and because he wanted to wait till he could get clear results. I'll be going to get tested with him cause he asked me to come with him. This is the only website where I find reassurance about my fears. I understand that other websites want to make sure they cover even the rarest cases but they really have fueled my fears. I guess I'll continue to find more distractions for the next few days until then. So Mike, are you in the medical field? I'm curious because you really seem to know a lot about HIV as well. Thank you both for your patience here. If you all believe in prayer please keep me in yours.

and also I really confused!!!doctor says you will show symptoms in 7 years or probably dead. and he doesnt recommend STD test if you dont have sore or discharge .sorry if I misunderstand .but some  say with a low viral load , no symptoms 10+. which one is true? based on my story, is epididymitis related to STD?Does urine test measure any STD symptoms ? I know only aswer is to  get tested and we can not change the past but  can get  lessons in future. just wondering to reliefthanks!!!!!

from what I've read the symptoms may take years to show up but the virus can show up in tests as early as 2 weeks soyu might want to get tested now since it's been so many years since that, you can expect clear results. I do agree with Dr. HHH, you would be either dying or already dead if you actually had it now. I'm just going to get tested with my husband cause I realize 6 weeks is still the window period and I do admit I'm afraid but I have to think about my unborn babies.

here is my story:I am 30 yr/old male , circumcized ,no drug, no smoking ,no drinking,no Iv ETC... 7 years ago(july 2000) I had unprotected vaginal sex with a sexworker/prostitute(unknown status) who is from either belarus or russia.I had 2 strokes and ejaculated after the unprotected sex part to her vagina.After that urinated and cleaned my penis. no blood and I was on top. but this was the nightmare for me just like her ( nickname:probablyjustparanoid)and afraid of going to get tested because of the stigma and what if I get pozitif test.I dont have any symptoms at all. in 2004 , I had only one and short protected vaginal sex with unknown status and condom was on. no tear , etc,, and after that cleaning etc.. 4 weeks later I had a terrible testicle pain .went to urolog and he did urine test and diagnosis epididymitis .I am going to gym too. he said dont lift heavy stuff, used antibiotics and recovered.in 2005 , i had unprotected one time oral and 3 times protected vaginal sex.and my testicle pain started again. other than this pain no symptoms at all . does this left testicle pain related to sex? urolog told me bacteria infection.(urinary tract infection)in 2000 risky episode:what are the risk of Hiv Assume if she is hiv+ ?Do I get any symptoms from that time or in future?what are the lifetime living or showing symptoms of hiv.?

question: I'd never thought I'd post here again but my husband is going to get tested for HIV at my request next week. It'll be 3 months. I'm extremely nervous. You can look up my posts from a few weeks back, to get to know more about my situation but long story short, I'm now 33 weeks pregnant, and almost 3 months ago my husband cheated on me (unprotected vag. but OW claimed that she was tested for HIV 2 weeks prior and was negative.) I tested negative for HIV, 2 days before the 6 weeks mark as well as for chlamydia and gonorrhea (3 weeks post exposure), also negative. I'm curious, Mike_no, Dr. Stupid, are you in the medical field? I've browsed through your posts and they're very insightful. I decided to finally ask my husband to get tested because for me it was already nerve racking to get tested at 6 weeks and waiting for those results. I know Dr. HHH's view on this but I realize it's all based on his experience. My OB doesn't recommend any more testing either and he even reminded me that in the labor/delivery units it's standard procedure to do HIV testing. I get urine tests done there every time, I figure that if there was anything wrong at all, he'd have me test further. From reading about ARS symptoms, these are the following I've felt since a week after my husband's one-time affair, recurrent mouth sores but at the time we were having protected sex, so I guess that doesn't count but shortly after having unprotected sex (stupid, I know, you can look up my post on this for explanation), I had some persistent itching on my chin, I read that persistent itch was an ARS, diarrhea on and off, when I had it it was gone in about three days. I've had diarrhea like this about every month since that time, and rescently I had it for 3 days but it's been no more than 3 a day and now I'm over that. I've had no fever or night sweats and neither has my husband, however, he's had diarrhea on and off as well and just about as often as me. One time I noticed a red blotch on the back of his left leg which he had no idea how he got it but it's now gone. Today he told me he feels like he's coming down with a cold since he seemed to have a sore throat and that's it. That freaked me out  but I realize that symptoms are not reliable. I've had a few mild headaches but considering how far along I'm in my pregnancy, I figure it has to do with that and since this is a twin pregnancy I figure that I may be getting preeclampsia but that's another story, all I know is that headaches in pregnant women are common in those cases. I realize that ARS symptoms come all at once and leave at once but I've never felt these symptoms during my first pregnancy. I'm sorry for all the rambling, I'm just anxious and I guess my question is, can I expect another negative test describing all this? Are the odds in my favor?
title: Dr. Stupid and Mike_no
